meanings.definition: A process in which large hydrocarbon molecules are broken down into smaller molecules using hydrogen and a catalyst.
meanings.sent1: The hydrocracking of oil helps produce more gasoline.
meanings.sent2: Refineries use hydrocracking to make various petroleum products.
meanings.sent3: Why did the scientist bring a tiny hammer to the hydrocracking experiment? To break down the molecules!
meanings.sent4: In the world of chemistry, hydrocracking is like a molecular demolition derby.
meanings.sent5: The hydrocracking process is like a molecular puzzle being solved.

meanings.definition: The act or process of hydrocracking.
meanings.sent1: The hydrocracking at the plant was done efficiently.
meanings.sent2: Many engineers study the intricacies of hydrocracking.
meanings.sent3: During the hydrocracking demonstration, everyone wore hard hats.
meanings.sent4: The hydrocracking operation hummed like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing hydrocracking in action is like watching a chemical ballet.
